articles.title: IN CASE YOU MISSED IT-Schedule of Reuters features from this week
articles.description: (ARGENTINA-ART/INFLATION (PIX, TV), 225 words) Few tourists, deserted streets in casino hub Macau after reopening MACAU - Three years of COVID-19 forced Becky Zhang’s specialty food business in Macau to near collapse.
articles.content: Every week, Reuters journalists produce scores of multimedia features and human-interest stories from around the world. Below are some stories from this week selected by our editors, as well as explanatory context and background to help you understan... [4361 chars]

articles.title: Enzo Fernandez to Chelsea transfer talks stall but Benoit Badiashile deal finalised amid Mykhaylo Mudryk move
articles.description: Chelsea’s move for Enzo Fernandez has stalled, with Benfica unhappy with their attempts to reduce or spread the cost of a deal to sign the Argentina midfielder.
articles.content:
C helsea’s move for Enzo Fernandez has stalled, with Benfica unhappy with their attempts to reduce or spread the cost of a deal to sign the Argentina midfielder.
The Blues have been seeking to pay the transfer fee for Fernandez in instalments as they... [1162 chars]

articles.title: Lionel Messi told Sergio Aguero to 'stop drinking' during Argentina's World Cup celebrations after Qatar 2022 triumph
articles.description: It's not surprising Argentina's World Cup winning team celebrated their Qatar 2022 win hard.But it turns out the party was so full on that La Albicele
articles.content:
It’s not surprising Argentina’s World Cup winning team celebrated their Qatar 2022 win hard.
But it turns out the party was so full on that La Albiceleste’s captain Lionel Messi had tried to calm ex-striker Sergio Aguero down, telling him to slow dow... [2138 chars]

articles.title: Argentine government says 80.1% of 2021/22 soybean crop sold so far
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan 4 (Reuters) -Argentine farmers have so far sold 80.1% of the 2021/22 soybean harvest, the country's agriculture ministry said on Wednesday, slightly behind the 80.5% sold during the same period in the previous cycle.Producers in Argentina, the world's top exporter of processed soy, sold 551,000 tonnes of the season's soybean in the week of Dec. 22-28, marking
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Jan 4 (Reuters) -
Argentine farmers have so far sold 80.1% of the 2021/22 soybean harvest, the country's agriculture ministry said on Wednesday, slightly behind the 80.5% sold during the same period in the previous cycle.

articles.title: Argentine artist paints on inflation-hit bank notes
articles.description: Argentina's cash has lost so much value in recent years that local artist Sergio Guillermo Diaz finds painting on even the most valuable banknotes has become affordable.
articles.content:
SALTA, Argentina, Jan 3 (Reuters) - Argentina's cash has lost so much value in recent years that local artist Sergio Guillermo Diaz finds painting on even the most valuable banknotes has become affordable.
With annual inflation that likely neared 100... [1442 chars]
